caption.p: Map of the Rorippa austriaca populations of the Czech Republic, Germany and the Netherlands used for the experiment ( small solid black dots) and experimental sites in each region ( open squares). The darker gray fill roughly depicts the original core distribution of the species, although its precise borders are unknown (modified after Bleeker 2003). Populations in the Czech Republic are at the edge of the core distribution. Germany, the Netherlands, Scandinavia and other parts of Western Europe are newly colonized areas. For exact coordinates of the R. austriaca populations, see Table S1
